com.googlecode.jmxtrans

Interface OutputWriter

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BaseOutputWriter, DailyKeyOutWriter, GangliaWriter, GraphiteWriter, KeyOutWriter, NagiosWriter, RRDToolWriter, RRDWriter, StackdriverWriter, StatsDWriter, StdOutWriter, VelocityWriter

    public interface OutputWriter
    Interface which defines a writer for taking jmx data and writing it out in whatever format you want. Note that this class uses a feature of Jackson to serialize anything that implements this as a "@class". That way, when Jackson deserializes implementations of this interface, it is done with new objects that implement this interface.
    Author:
    jon

      • setObjectPoolMap

        void setObjectPoolMap(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,org.apache.commons.pool.KeyedObjectPool> poolMap)
        Some writers, like GraphiteWriter will use this for object pooling. Things like Socket connections to remote servers that we are writing to are ripe for pooling. This is super extensible as a map because we could have multiple object pools.
